III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A (discharged in September) disclosed to Staff 2 who talked
with them in the last few days that Staff 1 supplied vapes (or a
vape) to Youth A when they were placed at DABSJ.
Investigation Complainant 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/15/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported Youth A called
her and wanted to talk about staff who still worked at the facility.
Youth A informed Complainant 1 that Staff 1 would allow Youth A
to vape with staff during trips in the facility van. Youth A reported
Staff 1 was engaged in this behavior and Youth A described Staff
1 as “really cool”. Complainant 1 who does not work in the
program waited until meeting with a facility supervisor before
calling in the report because she was unsure if she needed to
report the allegations since Youth A had left the program in
September 2023. Youth A informed Complainant 1 this vaping
took place several times in the van.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/15/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
and provided a safety plan that had been developed which
included Staff 1 having no one-to-one contact with youth until this
investigation is completed. She reported Complainant 1 received
the allegations from Youth A during a recent phone call from
Youth A who was in the program from 6/5/2023 until 9/23/2023.
Administrator was going to review outing logs and provide a copy
to determine if Staff 1 had transported Youth A for an outing. She
reported Staff 1 generally transports youth to school or doctor’s
appointments. Administrator was interviewed again, face to
face at the facility on 3/18/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. She reported Staff 2 is the type of staff who holds others
accountable, so other staff don’t share things with him. She
reported she will send Staff 2 into situations that required strict
oversight and supervision.
2

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility Youth A is
currently lodged on 3/18/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Youth A reported liking all of the staff at the facility in
question and “really loved” Staff 1. Staff 1 was easy to talk with
and understood Youth A. Youth A reported no staff gave her a
vape while at the facility, but Youth A did witness Staff 1 vaping.
Staff 1 would not allow the youth to vape. Youth A reported
believing other staff also vape because Youth A would observe
the shape of a vape in staff’s pockets. Youth A observed smoke
coming out of the sleeve of Staff 3 during a walk and believed
Staff 3 was vaping because of this smoke. Youth A reported never
vaping while at the facility and she was unable to remember telling
anyone that she had vaped or had vaped with Staff 1 while at the
facility. Youth A reported never vaping in a van and didn’t recall
telling someone of this allegation. Youth A identified Youth C who
is no longer at the facility but did get vapes from school and bring
the vape to the facility. Youth A reported youth would hide a vape
in the family bathroom at the Y-center and share the vape
between youth when changing to go swimming.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/18/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported vaping but
never around any youth especially when transporting youth. She
reported once she dropped the vape in the presence of a youth,
(she was unable to identify) which caused her great
embarrassment. This occurred within the first couple of weeks she
began employment at the facility. Youth A reported observing the
shape of a vape in her pocket, so Staff 1 has not carried a vape
on her person since then. Staff 1 denied giving or sharing a vape
with any youth in the program on campus or off campus. Staff 1
reported Youth C had a vape during a transport, but Youth C
scared her, so she informed other staff (she was unable to recall
which staff) when returning to campus. Staff 1 believes the other
staff (unable to recall which staff) did speak to Youth C about
Youth C’s behaviors, but she had no evidence to support this
belief.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/18/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
she stopped vaping, and she previously received the vape pens
from friends at school. She reported staff have not given any
youth a vape since last summer (2023) and Staff 1 never had
anything to do with staff giving vapes to youth. Youth B never
witnessed Staff 1 vaping. The primary youth who engaged in
vaping was Youth C and the staff providing the vape was Staff 4.
This issue was investigated (2024C0001118SI). Another staff
3

involved was Staff 5 and this was also investigated
(2024C0001118SI).
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/18/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He denied having any
knowledge of youth or staff vaping at the facility. He denied ever
observing any staff or youth vaping. He reported having no
concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/18/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported hearing
about staff vaping on campus and incidents with staff and youth
vaping but never witnessed this activity. He was unable to provide
any names because he only heard rumors. He reported being on
numerous outings but never witnessing any vaping by staff or
youth during the outing. He reported if a youth began to talk about
vaping, he would shut the conversation down because “you can’t
have that going on”.
Documents Reviewed:
D.A. Blodgett ST. John’s safety plan Re: Staff 1 dated
3/15/2024. This document outlines the changes in Staff 1’s daily
work activities for the current timeframe. Starting on 3/15/24, Staff
1 is not to have any 1:1 contact with youth, outside of camera
view, until further notice. Staff 1 is not to transport 1:1 nor have
conversations in any area outside of public spaces. This
document is signed by Staff 1 on 3/18/2024.
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed.
Documentation indicates Staff 1 was hired in July 2023 and had
no disciplinary action documented in her file. Staff 1 is current on
training.
D.A. Blodgett ST. John’s Agency Policy – Tobacco Free
Environment Policy dated 2/1/2018. This document outlines that
tobacco use is prohibited in all agency buildings and on the
campus. Staff are not to use any form of tobacco while in the
presence of youth on and off campus. Tobacco use is prohibited
in all facility vehicles.
Email from Administrator outlining the “secure outings”
involving Youth A. This document lists 55 outings Youth A was
involved in, and Staff 1 is never identified as the staff providing
supervision.
4

Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation there is no
evidence that supports Staff 1 engaged in the activity of vaping in
front of Youth A or sharing a vape with Youth A. Issues of youth
and staff vaping has been addressed in prior special
investigations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
